relevant_findings.lesions: Multiple tender subcutaneous nodules of the left hallux with background violaceous discoloration and edema limited to the toe.
Pruritic, erythematous, confluent, maculopapular skin lesions located on the trunk, inframammary fold, groin, and genital and perianal areas.
relevant_findings.biopsy: Histology revealed a mononuclear cell infiltrate consistent with LCH.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening of disease with severe new flare of multiple papulonodular lesions requiring new treatment.
